body:
# Tracking Issue for Rustdoc Askama Migration

[Zulip Discussion](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/266220-rustdoc/topic/rustdoc.20allocations.20are.20slow)

This issue is to track the progress of migrating rustdoc's HTML rendering to Askama.

## Suggested Workflow
If you'd like to work on a component, please leave a comment claiming it so that work doesn't conflict.
Work on translating the current series of `format!()` and string building calls into an HTML template. Where possible, try to keep as much logic as possible on the Rust side. Make sure to refer to [`STYLE.md`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/librustdoc/html/templates/STYLE.md) for templating style, especially using comment blocks to minimize whitespace.

A specific example of a migration (and some style considerations) is [here](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/108784#pullrequestreview-1325314611).

## Components to Migrate

- [x] Sidebar (#108784)
- [ ] Content
    - [x] Stability/Portability/Deprecation (#108757)
    - [ ] Item (`print_item.rs`)
        - [x] Item Header
        - [ ] Doc Block
        - [ ] Modules
        - [ ] Functions
        - [ ] Traits
        - [ ] Structs
        - [x] Unions (#109925)
        - [ ] Enums
        - [ ] Typedefs (#110470)
        - [ ] Macros
        - [ ] ProcMacros
        - [ ] Primitives
        - [ ] Statics
        - [ ] Constants
        - [ ] Foreign Types
        - [~~Keywords~~](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/111314#issuecomment-1537413925) 
        - [ ] Opaque Types
        - [ ] Trait Aliases
     - [ ] Scraped examples
- [ ] Source View
  - [x] Line Numbers (#109187)
  - [ ] Code Highlighting

## Implementation History

- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/86157
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/89695
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92526
